intro: Astracantha vedica, commonly known as the Indian thornapple, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and ovate, while its fruits are follicles that split open to release seeds. Astracantha vedica is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
